# Arpeggio: add2 in G (Shape: D)

An arpeggio is a musical technique where the notes of a chord are played in a sequence rather than simultaneously. In this case, we will explore the add2 arpeggio in the key of G using the shape of a D major chord.

## Notes and Intervals

The notes in the G add2 arpeggio using the D shape are G (root), A (major 2nd), B (major 3rd), and D (perfect 5th). The intervals in this arpeggio are Root-2nd, 2nd-3rd, and 3rd-5th.

## Genre and Musical Flavor

The add2 arpeggio in G can add a dreamy and ethereal quality to music. It is commonly used in genres such as pop, rock, and ballads to create a more emotive and atmospheric sound. The add2 interval gives a sense of tension and resolution, adding depth and emotion to the music.

## Songs

Here are three songs that feature the G add2 arpeggio in the D shape:

1. **"Yesterday" by The Beatles**: The intro of this iconic song features an add2 arpeggio in the key of G using the D shape.

2. **"Babylon" by David Gray**: This song uses add2 arpeggios to create a melancholic and introspective mood.

3. **"I Don't Want to Miss a Thing" by Aerosmith**: The acoustic guitar part in this power ballad includes add2 arpeggios to enhance the emotional impact of the song.
